completedHtmlOnCondition.html: Thank you for completing this survey! Please follow this link to acknowledge your Prolific completion. https://app.prolific.com/submissions/complete?cc=C15JPNHQ

pages.name: page1

elements.name: ProlificID
elements.title: What is your Prolific ID?

elements.name: ChildAgeYears
elements.title: What is this child's current age in years?

elements.name: ChildHeight
elements.title: What is this child's CURRENT height?

elements.name: ChildWeight
elements.title: What is this child's CURRENT weight?

elements.name: ChildHealth
elements.title: In general, how would you describe this child's health?

elements.name: ChildTeeth
elements.title: How would you describe the condition of this child's teeth?

elements.name: ChildPhysicalActivity
elements.title: DURING THE PAST WEEK, on how many days did this child exercise, play a sport, or participate in physical activity for at least 60 minutes?

elements.name: ChildChronicHealth
ChildBreathing
elements.title: Breathing or other respiratory problems (such as wheezing or shortness of breath)

elements.name: ChildEating
elements.title: Eating or swallowing because of a health condition

elements.name: ChildDigestion
elements.title: Digesting food, including stomach/intestinal problems, constipation, or diarrhea

elements.name: ChildPain
elements.title: Repeated or chronic physical pain, including headaches or other back or body pain

elements.name: ChildToothache
elements.title: Toothaches

elements.name: ChildGums
elements.title: Bleeding gums

elements.name: ChildCavities
elements.title: Decayed teeth or cavities
DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, has this child had FREQUENT or CHRONIC difficulty with any of the following?

elements.name: ChildHealthOther
ChildConcentration
elements.title: Serious difficulty concentrating, remember, or making decisions because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition

elements.name: ChildStairs
elements.title: Serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs

elements.name: ChildDressBathe
elements.title: Difficulty dressing or bathing

elements.name: ChildHearing
elements.title: Deafness or problems with hearing

elements.name: ChildEyesight
elements.title: Blindness or problems with seeing, even when wearing glasses
Does this child have any of the following?

elements.name: ChildVisionHearingOther
elements.title: Does this child have any other vision or hearing issues (e.g., frequent ear infections; nearsighted or farsighted)?

elements.name: ChildVisionHearingExp
elements.visibleIf: {ChildVisionHearingOther} = true
elements.title: If yes, please explain:

elements.name: ChildGenetic
elements.title: Has a doctor or other health care provider EVER told you that this child has a genetic or inherited condition?

elements.name: ChildGeneticExp
elements.visibleIf: {ChildGenetic} = true
elements.title: If yes, please explain:

elements.name: ChildHealthConditions
ChildConduct
elements.title: Behavioral or Conduct Problems

elements.name: ChildConductCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildConduct} = true
elements.title: Does this child CURRENTLY have Behavioral or Conduct Problems?

elements.name: ChildConductLevel
elements.visibleIf: {ChildConductCurrent} = true
elements.title: Are the current Behavioral or Conduct Problems, Mild, Moderate, or Severe?

elements.name: ChildDevDelay
elements.title: Developmental Delay

elements.name: ChildDevDelayCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildDevDelay} = true
elements.title: Does this child CURRENTLY have Developmental Delay?

elements.name: ChildDevDelayLevel
elements.visibleIf: {ChildDevDelayCurrent} = true
elements.title: Are the current Developmental Delays, Mild, Moderate, or Severe?

elements.name: ChildIntellDis
elements.title: Intellectual Disability

elements.name: ChildIntellDisCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildIntellDis} = true

elements.name: ChildIntellDisLevel
elements.visibleIf: {ChildIntellDisCurrent} = true
elements.title: Is the current Intellectual Disability, Mild, Moderate, or Severe?

elements.name: ChildSpeechLang
elements.title: Speech or other language disorder

elements.name: ChildSpeechLangCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildIntellDis} = true
elements.title: Does this child CURRENTLY have a Speech or other language disorder?

elements.name: ChildSpeechLangLevel
elements.visibleIf: {ChildSpeechLangCurrent} = true
elements.title: Is the current Speech or other language disorder, Mild, Moderate, or Severe?

elements.name: ChildLearnDisCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildLearnDis} = true
elements.title: Does this child CURRENTLY have a Learning Disability?

elements.name: ChidLearnDisLevel
elements.visibleIf: {ChildLearnDisCurrent} = true
elements.title: Is the current Learning Disability, Mild, Moderate, or Severe?

elements.name: ChildAutism
elements.title: Autism Spectrum Disorder (includes Asperger's Disorder or Pervasive Developmental Disorder)

elements.name: ChildAutismCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildAutism} = true
elements.title: Does this child CURRENTLY have an Autism Spectrum Disorder (includes Asperger's Disorder or Pervasive Developmental Disorder)?

elements.name: ChildAutismLevel
elements.visibleIf: {ChildAutismCurrent} = true
elements.title: Is the current Autism Spectrum Disorder (includes Asperger's Disorder or Pervasive Developmental Disorder), Mild, Moderate, or Severe?

elements.name: ChildADHD
elements.title: Attention Deficit Disorder or Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADD or ADHD)

elements.name: ChildADHDCurrent
elements.visibleIf: {ChildADHD} = true

elements.title: Is the current Attention Deficit Disorder or Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADD or ADHD), Mild, Moderate, or Severe?
Has a doctor or other health care provider, or educator EVER told you that this child has any of the following (answer yes or no to all):

elements.name: ChildSleep
ChildSleepHabits
elements.title: This child's sleep habits in the past 7 days....

rows.text: This child had difficulty falling asleep.
This child slept through the night.
This child had a problem with his/her sleep.
This child had trouble sleeping.
This child goes to bed at about the same time on weeknights.

elements.name: ChildSleepHours
elements.title: DURING THE PAST WEEK, about how many hours of sleep did this child usually get on weeknights?
Please respond to each question or statement by marking one response per row.

pages.description: Thank you for completing this questionnaire. The questions will ask about your child , your home, and yourself. Please respond to this questionnaire only if you are the parent of a child ages 5-12 years. If you have more than one child in the 5-12 year old age range, please choose one child to think about when answering all questions. Think of the same child throughout the questionnaire. Thank you!

elements.name: ChildSexBirth
elements.title: What was this child's sex at birth?

elements.name: ChildGenderCurrent
elements.title: What is this child's current gender?

elements.name: ChildBehGirls
elements.title: Over the last year, how frequently did this child engage in behaviors or express preferences that are more commonly associated with girls?

elements.name: ChildBeGirl
elements.title: Over the last year, how frequently did this child state that they are, or want to be, a girl?

elements.name: ChildBehBoys
elements.title: Over the last year, how frequently did this child engage in behaviors or express preferences that are more commonly associated with boys?

elements.name: ChildBeBoy
elements.title: Over the last year, how frequently did this child state that they are, or want to be, a boy?

elements.name: ChildPubertyFemale
ChildPubertyGrowthFemale
elements.title: Would you say that this child's growth in height (getting taller):

choices.text: Has not yet begun to spurt ("spurt" means more growth than usual)
Has definitely started to happen but is not finished
Seems completed (child is about as tall as she is going to get)

elements.name: ChildPubertyHairFemale
elements.title: How about the growth of body hair (e.g. under arms)? Would you say this child's body hair:

choices.text: Has definitely started growing but is not finished
Seems completed (child has as much body hair as she is going to get)

elements.name: ChildPubertySkinFemale
elements.title: Have you noticed any skin changes, especially pimples?

choices.text: Skin changes have definitely started but are not finished

elements.name: ChildPubertyBreastFemale
elements.title: Have this child's breasts begun to grow?

choices.text: Breast growth has definitely started but is not finished

elements.name: ChildPubertyMenstruate
elements.title: Has this child begun to menstruate?

elements.name: ChildPubertyMenstruateAge
elements.visibleIf: {ChildPubertyMenstruate} = 1
elements.title: If yes, how old was this child when she first got her period?

elements.visibleIf: {ChildSexBirth} = 1
elements.title: To answer each question, please select the answer that best describes what is happening to this child right now.

elements.name: ChildPubertyMale
ChildPubertyGrowthMale
elements.title: Would you say that this child's growth in height (getting taller):

choices.text: Has not yet begun to spurt ("spurt" means more growth than usual)
Has definitely started to happen but is not finished
Seems completed (child is about as tall as she is going to get)

elements.name: ChildPubertyHairMale
elements.title: How about the growth of body hair (e.g. under arms)? Would you say this child's body hair:

choices.text: Has definitely started growing but is not finished
Seems completed (child has as much body hair as she is going to get)

elements.name: ChildPubertySkinMale
elements.title: Have you noticed any skin changes, especially pimples?

choices.text: Skin changes have definitely started but are not finished

elements.name: ChildPubertyVoiceMale
elements.title: Has this child's voice started to change?

choices.text: Voice change is definitely happening but is not finished

elements.name: ChildPubertyFaceHairMale
elements.title: Has this child started to grow facial hair (beard or mustache)?

choices.text: Not yet started growing facial hair
Has barely started growing facial hair
Hair growth has definitely started (enough to shave)
Probably grows now as fast as it will ever grow

elements.visibleIf: {ChildSexBirth} = 2
elements.title: To answer each question, please select the answer that best describes what is happening to this child right now.

elements.name: ChildPACESpart1
ChildPACES1
elements.title: Has this child ever lived with a parent/caregiver who went to jail/prison?

elements.name: ChildPACES2
elements.title: Do you think this child ever felt unsupported, unloved, and/or unprotected?

elements.name: ChildPACES3
elements.title: Has this child ever lived with a parent/caregiver who had mental health issues? (for example, depression, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, PTSD, or an anxiety disorder)

elements.name: ChildPACES4
elements.title: Has a parent/caregiver ever insulted, humiliated, or put down this child?

elements.name: ChildPACES5
elements.title: Has this child's biological parent or any caregiver ever had, or currently has, a problem with too much alcohol, street drugs, or prescription medications use?

elements.name: ChildPACES6
elements.title: Has this child ever lacked appropriate care by any caregiver? (for example, not being protected from unsafe situations, or not cared for when sick or injured even when the resources were available)

elements.name: ChildPACES7
elements.title: Has this child ever seen or heard a parent/caregiver being screamed at, sworn at, insulted, or humiliated by another adult? Or has your child ever seen or heard a parent/caregiver being slapped, kicked, punched, beaten up, or hurt with a weapon?

elements.name: ChildPACES8
elements.title: Has any adult in the household often or very often pushed, grabbed, slapped, or thrown something at this child? Or has any adult in the household ever hit this child so hard that the child had marks or was injured? Or has any adult in the household ever threatened this child or acted in a way that made this child afraid that they might be hurt?

elements.name: ChildPACES9
elements.title: Has this child ever experienced sexual abuse? (for example, anyone touched this child or asked this child to touch that person in a way that was unwanted, or made the child feel uncomfortable, or anyone ever attempted or actually had oral, anal, or vaginal sex with this child)

elements.name: ChildPACES10
elements.title: Have there ever been significant changes in the relationship status of the child's caregiver(s)? (for example, a parent/caregiver got a divorce or separated, or a romantic partner moved in or out)

elements.name: ChildPACESTotal1
elements.title: Part 1: TOTAL

PART 1: At any point in time since this child was born, has this child seen or been present when the following experiences happened? Please include past and present experiences. Please note, some questions have more than one part separated by "OR." If any part of the question is answered "Yes," then the answer to the entire question is "Yes." Tally the number of statements that are TRUE for this child and enter the number in the box at the end of the list.

elements.name: ChildPACESpart2
ChildPACES11
elements.title: Has your child ever seen, heard, or been a victim of violence in your neighborhood, community, or school? (for example, targeted bullying, assault or other violent actions, war or terrorism)

elements.name: ChildPACES12
elements.title: Has your child experienced discrimination? (for example, being hassled or made to feel inferior or excluded because of their race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, learning differences, or disabilities)

elements.name: ChildPACES13
elements.title: Has your child ever had problems with housing? (for example, being homeless, not having a stable place to live, moved more than two times in a six-month period, faced eviction or foreclosure, or had to live with multiple families or family members)

elements.name: ChildPACES14
elements.title: Have you ever worried that your child did not have enough food to eat or that the food for your child would run out before you could buy more?

elements.name: ChildPACES15
elements.title: Has your child ever been separated from their parent or caregiver due to foster care or immigration?

elements.name: ChildPACES16
elements.title: Has your child ever lived with a parent/caregiver who had a serious physical illness or disability?

elements.name: ChildPACES17
elements.title: Has your child ever lived with a parent or caregiver who died?

elements.name: ChildPACESTotal2
elements.title: Part 2: TOTAL

PART 2: At any point in time since this child was born, has this child seen or been present when the following experiences happened? Please include past and present experiences. Please note, some questions have more than one part separated by "OR." If any part of the question is answered "Yes," then the answer to the entire question is "Yes." Tally the number of statements that are TRUE for this child and enter the number in the box at the end of the list.

elements.name: ChildSDQitems
elements.title: For each item, please mark Not True, Somewhat True, or Certainly True as it applies to this child. It would help us if you answered all items as best you can even if you are not absolutely certain. Please give your answers on the basis of this child's behavior over the last six months or this school year.

rows.text: Considerate of other people's feelings
Restless, overactive, cannot stay still for long
Often complains of headaches, stomach-aches or sickness
Shares readily with other children, for example toys, treats, pencils
Often loses temper
Rather solitary, prefers to play alone
Generally well behaved, usually does what adults request
Many worries or often seems worried
Helpful if someone is hurt, upset or feeling ill
Constantly fidgeting or squirming
Has at least one good friend
Often fights with other children or bullies them
Often unhappy, depressed or tearful
Generally liked by other children
Easily distracted, concentration wanders
Nervous or clingy in new situations, easily loses confidence
Kind to younger children
Often lies or cheats
Picked on or bullied by other children
Often offers to help others (parents, teachers, other children)
Thinks things out before acting
Steals from home, school or elsewhere
Gets along better with adults than with other children
Many fears, easily scared
Good attention span, sees work through to the end

elements.name: ChildSCSitems
elements.title: For each item, please mark your best response to indicate how well the sentence describes this child.

rows.text: This child accepts things when they do not go their way.
This child copes well with failure.
This child thinks before acting.
This child resolves problems with friends on their own.
This child can calm down when excited.
This child does what they are told to do.
This child is good at understanding others' feelings.
This child controls their temper when there is a disagreement.
This child shares things with others.
This child is helpful to others.
This child listens to others' points of view.
This child can give suggestions without being bossy.

elements.name: ChildCBQitems
elements.title: For each item, please mark your best response to indicate how well the sentence describes this child.

rows.text: This child understands others' feelings.
This child is socially aware of what is happening in a situation.
This child accurately interprets what a peer is trying to do.
This child exhibits good self-control in responding.
This child generates many solutions to interpersonal problems.
This child generates good quality solutions to interpersonal problems.
This child is aware of the effects of his/her behavior on others.
This child tries to make sad people happier.
This child helps others with their homework.
This child lets others use her/his toys or items.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: For each item, please mark your best response to indicate how well the sentence describes this child.

rows.text: This child is curious to investigate and understand new things.
This child is able to make observations and deductions before being told an answer.
This child gives unique responses that go beyond those of other children.
This child often wants to learn new things.
This child investigates new objects that appear in the household or community spaces.
This child likes to ask many questions.
If this child makes a mistake, they ask forgiveness.
This child often plans their own tasks well.
This child completes their own work without being asked or reminded to do so.
This child works diligently when trying to complete tasks or chores.
If this child cannot do something, they try again.
This child likes to finish tasks properly.
This child is slow and unhurried in deciding what to do next.
This child continues with a task even when it is tiring.
This child easily agrees to do tasks or errands.
This child willingly follows instructions.
When this child is directed to complete a task, they do it enthusiastically.
When this child is sent to complete an errand, they return on time.
If this child is told to do a chore, they do it.
This child is respectful towards adults.

elements.name: ChildFriends
elements.title: Compared to other children their age, how much difficulty does this child have making or keeping friends?

elements.name: ChildBullied
elements.title: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often was this child bullied, picked on, or excluded by other children? If the frequency changed throughout the year, report the highest frequency.

elements.name: ChildBullyOthers
elements.title: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often did this child bully others, pick on them, or exclude them? If the frequency changed throughout the year, report the highest frequency.

elements.name: ChildESLitems
elements.title: Before your child began primary/elementary school, how often did you or someone else in your home do the following activities with him or her?

rows.text: Read books
Tell stories
Sing songs
Play with alphabet toys (e.g., blocks with letters of the alphabet)
Talk about things you had done
Talk about what you had read
Play word games
Write letters or words
Read aloud signs and labels
Say counting rhymes or sing counting songs
Play with number toys (e.g., blocks with numbers)
Count different things
Play games involving shapes (e.g., shape sorting toys, puzzles)
Play with building blocks or construction toys
Play board or card games
Write numbers
Draw shapes
Measure or weigh things (e.g., when cooking)

elements.name: ChildAttendEC
elements.title: Did this child attend an early childhood education program or center for children under age 3 before first grade?

elements.name: ChildAttendKinder
elements.title: Did this child attend a pre-primary educational program for children age 3 or older, including kindergarten, before first grade?

elements.name: ChildAttendECKinderTime
elements.title: Approximately how long was this child in these programs all together (before first grade)?

elements.name: ChildAttendPrimaryAge
elements.title: How old was this child when he/she began the first grade of primary/elementary school?

elements.name: ChildEdAchieve
elements.title: How far in his/her education do you expect this child to go?

choices.text: Finish Postgraduate degree: Master's or Doctor

elements.name: ChildSchoolItems
elements.title: How often does this child do the following:

rows.text: Show interest and curiosity in new topics at school?
Work to finish school-related tasks they start?
Stay calm and in control when faced with an academic challenge?
Care about doing well in school?
Do all required homework?

elements.name: ChildDeviceUse
elements.title: ON MOST WEEKDAYS, about how much time does this child spend in front of a TV, computer, cellphone, or other device watching programs, playing games, accessing the internet, or using social media? Do not include time spent doing schoolwork.

elements.name: ChildPhone
elements.title: Does this child have a smartphone?

elements.name: ChildPhoneAge
elements.visibleIf: {ChildPhone} = 1
elements.title: If yes, at what age did they get it?

elements.name: ChildSocialMedia
elements.title: Does this child have an account on any social media website such as Instagram, Tiktok, Meta, or others?

elements.name: ChildEFQ
ChildEFQ1
elements.title: Pays attention when an adult is explaining or showing something ... (by listening carefully and/or watching the adult's demonstration with appropriate eye gaze/body orientation.)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ2
elements.title: Finishes an assigned task that is repetitive (e.g., picking up toys, putting away laundry)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ3
elements.title: Remains focused and engaged during lengthy adult-led activities (e.g., religious or performance event, family meal time) by listening carefully and contributing when appropriate.

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ4
elements.title: Remains focused and engaged during collaborative child-led activities (e.g., playing with siblings/peers)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: EFQ5
elements.title: Persists on a difficult task (e.g., homework, chore) by trying to figure things out, asking questions, and not quitting

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ6
elements.title: Gets deeply engaged in an activity they choose for themselves (e.g., drawing, reading, cooking, building, sports, games)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ7
elements.title: Ignores irrelevant activity/noise (e.g., crying sibling, TV, outside traffic) when working on an assigned task

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ8
elements.title: Completes an assigned task before moving to a next task

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ9
elements.title: Regains focus/focuses again on an assigned task when interrupted (e.g., family member asks an unrelated question or needs brief assistance)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ10
elements.title: Ignores a preferred, fun activity (e.g., playing) when asked to complete an assigned task (e.g., cleaning room)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ11
elements.title: Answers questions or tells a story without getting distracted by small details and/or losing train of thought

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ12
elements.title: Waits turn to speak (e.g., does not interrupt others, does not blurt out answers, thinks before speaking)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ13
elements.title: Stops an undesirable behavior when asked (e.g., stops fighting with sibling when asked by parent, stops misbehaving in the household)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ14
elements.title: Stops playing or doing something fun when asked (e.g., stops playing with friends when parent asks, stops watching TV when parent asks)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ15
elements.title: Waits for their turn to act (e.g., waits patiently in line at a grocery store or when sharing a toy with sibling)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ16
elements.title: Stops and thinks before acting (e.g., does not run out in front of a car, does not grab things they shouldn't)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ17
elements.title: Completes activities that require multiple steps (e.g., fetching multiple things in home or store/market, setting the table, cleaning a room by putting several things away)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ18
elements.title: Completes activities that require remembering lengthy instructions (e.g., rules of a game, household chores, cooking recipe)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ19
elements.title: Communicates in an organized way (e.g., retells the correct sequence of the events, explains how a game works so it is easy to understand)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ20
elements.title: Completes age-appropriate numerical mental calculation (e.g., adds prices of goods, calculates time, how much they are older than someone else)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ21
elements.title: Remembers and considers all options when making a choice (e.g., what to do when they get stuck on a household task or face a problem, food options)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ22
elements.title: Remembers physical directions, patterns, and where things are (e.g., knows walking routes, finds things in a grocery store, good at searching for a lost item or playing hide-and-seek)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ23
elements.title: Comes up with new ways for solving challenges (e.g., repurposes materials or toys, comes up with a new way to build a tower or fort after it collapses, solves a puzzle in a new way, comes up with a new strategy to complete a chore)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ24
elements.title: Expresses themselves in a new way when not understood by others (e.g., tries different ways to communicate their needs and wants)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ25
elements.title: Adjusts when plans/schedules change (e.g., follows along when daily schedule changes, does not complain when unexpected sickness leads to canceling a family vacation)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ26
elements.title: Understands conflicting perspectives/ideas (e.g., acknowledges a different point of view, accepts different ways of doing things, can see a situation from someone elses perspective)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ27
elements.title: Connects ideas/experiences to other ideas/experiences (e.g., identifies connections between books/movies and lived experiences, uses strategies learned at school to complete activities at home)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ28
elements.title: Adapts behavior based on what is required by the situation (e.g., switched characters/roles while playing a game, changes behavior based on playtime or study time)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ29
elements.title: Identifies and gathers necessary materials before an activity (e.g., finds appropriate coat, shoes, hat before going outside; gathers lunch box, homework, and backpack before going to school)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.title: Checks for mistakes before completing a task (e.g., reviews and corrects errors on class assignments)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ33
elements.title: Begins plans or routines without prompting (e.g., takes an initiative to help a family member, starts daily household chores on their own)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.name: ChildEFQ34
elements.title: Negotiates and incorporates peers' suggestions without conflict or resistance (e.g., works with others to plan roles during pretend play, negotiates with sibling about how to complete chores together)

choices.text: Almost always: shows behavior independently with ease on almost every occasion in different settings
Frequently/often: shows behavior independently with small effort on most occasions
Sometimes: shows behavior with medium effort, needs brief reminders, corrections, or support from an adult
Rarely: shows behavior with a lot of effort, needs repeated reminders, corrections, or support from an adult

elements.title: We are interested how often, independently, and easily your child shows each behavior when occasions call for it. Children who excel at a specific behavior should receive the highest rating ("almost always"), whereas most children will be between "frequently/often" and "sometimes". Those who are still developing and need a lot of support should receive a "rarely" rating.

elements.name: SelfParentStressNSCHh8
elements.title: How well do you think you are handling the day-to-day demands of raising children?

elements.name: SelfParentStressNCSHh9
elements.title: DURING THE PAST MONTH, how often have you felt...

rows.text: That this child is much harder to care for than most children their age?
That this child does things that really bother you a lot?
Angry with this child?

elements.name: SelfParentRohner
elements.title: These statements describe ways different caregivers act toward their children. Please think about how well each statement describes the way you treat this child. Respond as to whether you do each item almost every day, once a week, once a month, or almost never.

rows.text: I see to it that this child knows exactly what (s)he may or may not do.
I always tell this child how (s)he should behave.
I insist that this child do exactly as (s)he is told.
I make this child feel wanted and needed.
I let this child do anything (s)he wants to do.
I make this child feel what (s)he does is important.
I care about what this child thinks and encourage her/him to talk about it.
I want to control whatever this child does.
I let this child know I love him/her.
I treat this child gently and kindly.

elements.name: SelfParentMICS
SelfParentMICS1
elements.title: Took away privileges, forbade something my child liked, or did not allow him/her to leave the house.

elements.name: SelfParentMICS2
elements.title: Explained why something (the behavior) was wrong.

elements.name: SelfParentMICS4
elements.title: Shouted, yelled at or screamed at him/her.

elements.name: SelfParentMICS6
elements.title: Spanked, hit, or slapped him/her.

elements.name: SelfParentMICS12
elements.title: Do you believe that in order to bring up (raise, educate) your child properly, you need to physically punish him/her?

All adults use certain ways to teach children the right behavior or to address a behavior problem. Please read the following methods that are used and select whether you or anyone else in your household has used this with your child in the past month.

elements.title: Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?

columns.text: More than half of the days

rows.text: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
Little interest or pleasure in doing things

elements.name: SelfSupport
elements.title: We are interested in how you feel about the following statements. Read each statement carefully. Indicate how you feel about each statement. A "special person" could refer to a spouse, partner, friend, family member, or other important person in your life.

rows.text: There is a special person who is around when I am in need.
There is a special person with whom I can share joys and sorrows.
My family really tries to help me.
I get the emotional help & support I need from my family.
I have a special person who is a real source of comfort to me.
My friends really try to help me.
I can count on my friends when things go wrong.
I can talk about my problems with my family.
I have friends with whom I can share my joys and sorrows.
There is a special person in my life who cares about my feelings.
My family is willing to help me make decisions.
I can talk about my problems with my friends.

elements.name: SelfDiscrim
elements.title: In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to you?

rows.text: You are treated with less courtesy or respect than other people.
You receive poorer service than other people at restaurants or stores.
People act as if they think you are not smart.
People act as if they are afraid of you.
You are threatened or harassed.
